New Records: Virat Kohli becomes the leading run scorer in the history of T20 World Cup.
Key Match Events: India defeated Bangladesh by five runs in a rain-curtailed T20 World Cup match on November 2, 2022.
Virat Kohli scored an unbeaten 64 off 44 deliveries.
KL Rahul returned to form with a 32-ball 50.
Hasan Mahmud took 3 wickets for 47 runs for Bangladesh.
Liton Das top-scored for Bangladesh with a 27-ball 60.
Arshdeep Singh picked up two wickets for India.
India defended a revised target of 151 in 16 overs, restricting Bangladesh to 145/6.
Nurul Hasan hit a maximum and a four in the final over, needing 7 runs off the last ball, but India survived.
Taskin Ahmed bowled a dream spell, conceding just 15 runs in his four overs.
KL Rahul's direct hit run-out of Litton Das was a pivotal moment.
Hardik Pandya picked up two wickets in an over, changing the game.
Suryakumar Yadav took two good catches, including a crucial one of Shakib Al Hasan.
Arshdeep Singh's final over under pressure was crucial in India's win.
Pre-Game Insights: Dinesh Karthik was likely to miss the match due to a back spasm, with Rishabh Pant expected to replace him.
KL Rahul was expected to retain his place in the playing XI despite being out of form.
Post-Match Reflections: Virat Kohli expressed his happiness with his batting performance and his love for playing at Adelaide.
The Indian team went to the top of the table with this win.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was interrupted by rain, reducing it to 16 overs per side.
The Indian team used a shoe-cleaner brush to scrape the soles of their shoes to move freely on the wet outfield.
India's recent record defending targets was iffy, having lost 4 out of 7 matches since September.
